title: About Me
text:
Research Focus
My work bridges the gap between theoretical physics and experimental implementation:

Superconducting Qubits: Analyzing drive-induced state transitions and resonator decay to improve readout fidelity.
Pulse Engineering: Exploring techniques like DRACHMA for active resonator reset and maintaining QNDness (Quantum Non-Demolition) during readout.
Light-Matter Interaction: I have conducted numerical investigations into 3-level Jaynes-Cummings Models and the Bose-Hubbard model using both Python and C++.

title: About Me
text:
Technical Expertise
I enjoy solving complex problems through a mix of analytical derivation and numerical simulation. My toolkit includes:

Languages: Python, Julia, and C++ (with a focus on high-performance stochastic simulations).
Frameworks: Qiskit for quantum circuit design, QuTiP for open quantum systems, and QuantumCumulant.jl for symbolic derivations.
Methods: Schrieffer-Wolff transformations, Lindblad Master Equations, and the Gillespie Algorithm.

I also believe in social responsibility and actively volunteer with Prayatana, an organization dedicated to providing education and resources to underprivileged children in Mohali.
